page.title: 15The Local Bakery
page.content: Mr Geary met us at the door of the bakery.He told us how the bakery had been going for nearly a hundred years.All the other bakeries in the area have given up long ago but Geary's has survived. We saw the great silo outside where the white flower is stored and we saw the huge travelling oven where the dough goes in and comes out as bread.The finished bread is wheeled into a lift and taken down to a loading bay where there are 47 vans and a fork lift truck. We went to the cake department where cakes are finished off by hand ready for weddings and birthdays.We watched a man decorating a cake and were allowed to use icing bags to write our names on a table.Mr Geary then told us to go along the racks and choose a cake. {Gemma P.
